body:
I think `writer` was not necessary surely, but `reader` is used by a few people. for example:

```ruby
$ vim activerecord/lib/active_record/attribute_methods/serialization.rb
 99       def type_cast_attribute_for_write(column, value)
100         if column && coder = self.class.serialized_attributes[column.name] ★
101           Attribute.new(coder, value, :unserialized)
102         else
103           super
104         end
105       end
106
107       def read_attribute_before_type_cast(attr_name)
108         if serialized_attributes.include?(attr_name) ★
109           super.unserialized_value
110         else
111           super
112         end
113       end
```

or should we fix the above code :) ?
